column1: 2.  On  a  consideration  of  all  the  evidence  the  only  inference  that  can  be  arrived  at

CA/HCC/0113/22: should be consistent with the guilt of the accused only.
If on a consideration of the items of circumstantial evidence if an inference can be
drawn which is consistent with the innocence of the accused, then one cannot say
that the charges have been proved beyond reasonable doubt.
If upon a consideration of the proved items of circumstantial evidence if the only
inference that can be drawn is that the accused committed the offence then they can

column1: 5.  The  prosecution  must  prove  that  no  one  else  other  than  the  accused  had  the

CA/HCC/0113/22: opportunity of  committing the offence, the accused can be found  guilty only and
